title: Shillong Plateau
text:
The Shillong Plateau is a <a href="plateau">plateau</a> in eastern <a href="Meghalaya">Meghalaya</a> state, northeastern India. The plateau's southern, northern and western ridges form the <a href="Garo%20Hills">Garo</a>, <a href="Khasi%20Hills">Khasi</a> and <a href="Jaintia%20Hills">Jaintia Hills</a> respectively.
The plateau shows numerous fracture lineaments in satellite images and has been subjected to extensive and compressive forces in the N-S and E-W direction respectively. Several deep earthquakes point to tectonic activity in the <a href="Mantle%20%28geology%29">mantle</a>, such as from the <a href="1897%20Assam%20earthquake">1897 Assam earthquake</a> along the <a href="Thrust%20fault%23Blind%20thrust%20faults">blind</a> <a href="Oldham%20Fault">Oldham Fault</a>.
